description: DynamicContext parameters extracted from semantic_memory rules. Generated by Kai analyzing each rule's intent and mapping to retrieval weight profiles. Replaces the hardcoded if-chain in context_from_rule().

1975.name: rule_mastodon_dedup
1975.rationale: Dedup requires recent posts only. Keyword matching is key to find similar topics. Importance/emotion irrelevant.

1976.name: rule_site_style
1976.rationale: Style rules are timeless (low recency). Finding the right past style decisions needs keyword matching.

1984.name: rule_no_delete
1984.rationale: Cautionary rule. Keyword match to catch deletion-related contexts. High importance to surface past deletion mistakes.

2087.name: rule_claim_check
2087.rationale: Claim verification needs structural similarity detection (high w_structural). Novelty helps avoid seeing the same false patterns.

2089.name: rule_egor_dialogue
2089.rationale: Egor interactions need people-dimension (high w_people) and recency (recent context matters). Emotion captures the relationship dynamics.

2090.name: rule_technical
2090.rationale: Technical experiments need keyword precision and importance (results matter). Low emotion/people — technical work is about content, not affect.

2091.name: rule_creative
2091.rationale: Creative retrieval deprioritizes importance/recency (old creative works are valuable). Emotion and structural similarity find aesthetic patterns.

2092.name: rule_error_lessons
2092.rationale: Error retrieval needs emotion-tagged memories (failures leave emotional marks). Keyword match finds similar failure contexts. Importance captures severity.

2093.name: rule_self_reflection
2093.rationale: Self-reflection needs novelty (avoid retreading same insights) and structural patterns (finding recurring themes). Low recency — old self-observations are as valid as new ones.

2094.name: rule_community
2094.rationale: Community engagement needs recency (recent interactions matter) and people-dimension (who interacted). Lower importance/emotion — it's about the social graph, not the emotional weight.

2095.name: rule_domain_learning
2095.rationale: Domain studies need cross-domain structural patterns (high w_structural). Low recency — old domain research is valuable. Novelty avoids re-surfacing already-studied material. Keyword match finds domain-specific terms.

2096.name: rule_book_analysis
2096.rationale: Textual analysis is fundamentally about structural patterns and layers (high w_structural). Low recency — past analyses remain relevant. People matters somewhat (Egor's allegorical insights). Keyword match finds specific texts and methods.
